lines.content: * Represents the main entry point for the task management chatbot.
* It initialises the user interface, storage and task list, handling user input and executing commands.

* Displays a welcome message and continuously reads and processes user commands
* until the exit command is received.
* The main entry point of the application.
* Creates and runs an instance of {@code Julie}.
* Parses user input and returns the corresponding command.
* Handles the extraction of relevant details from user commands
* and ensures proper formatting before creating appropriate command objects.

* Handles file storage operations for loading and saving tasks.
* This class is responsible for persisting task data to a file and retrieving it upon initialization.
* Constructs a {@code Storage} object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path of the file where tasks are stored.
* Loads tasks from the specified file. If the file does not exist, it will be created.
* @return A list of tasks loaded from the file.
* Saves the given list of tasks to the file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
* Parses a line from the file and converts it into a {@code Task}.
* This method reads the saved task format and reconstructs the appropriate {@code Task} object.
* @param line The line of text from the file representing a task.
* @return A reconstructed {@code Task} object, or {@code null} if the line is corrupted.
* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to manage them.
* This class allows tasks to be added, deleted, retrieved, and displayed.
* Constructs a {@code TaskList} initialized with an existing list of tasks.
* @param tasks The initial list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Deletes a task from the task list based on its index.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed (zero-based).
* Retrieves a task from the list by its index.
* @param index The index of the task (zero-based).
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Displays all tasks in the list with index numbers.
* Returns a copy of the list of tasks to maintain encapsulation.
* @return A new list containing all tasks.
return new ArrayList<>(tasks);  // Returns a copy to maintain encapsulation
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Handles all user interactions for the chatbot.

* Displays a message confirming that a task has been marked as done.

* @throws WrongFormatException If the deadline description or date/time is missing or if the date/time
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws WrongFormatException {

* Represents a command to add a new ToDo task to the task list.

* Represents an abstract command that can be executed in the task management application.
* Subclasses must implement the {@code execute} method to define specific command behaviors.
* Executes the command, performing operations on the task list, UI, and storage.
* @param tasks The task list containing the user's tasks.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage system for saving and loading tasks.
* @throws WrongFormatException If the command is not properly formatted.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws WrongFormatException;
* Determines whether this command will terminate the application.
* By default, commands do not exit the program.
* @return {@code true} if the command causes the program to exit, {@code false} otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a {@code DeleteCommand} with the specified task index.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the command to delete a task.
* The task is removed from the task list, saved to storage, and acknowledged via the UI.
* @param tasks The task list from which the task will be removed.
* @param ui The user interface to display feedback to the user.
* @param storage The storage system to persist the updated task list.
* @throws WrongFormatException If the provided index is out of bounds (i.e., task does not exist).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws WrongFormatException {
throw new WrongFormatException("Oops! That task number doesn't exist!\n" +
* Represents a command to terminate the chatbot session.

* @param tasks The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui The user interface to display the farewell message.
* @param storage The storage system (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents an exception that is thrown when a user inputs a command in an incorrect format.
* This exception is used to enforce proper command syntax in the chatbot.
* Constructs a new {@code WrongFormatException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the format error.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* A {@code Deadline} task includes a description and a due date/time.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd-MM-yyyy HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, hh:mm a");
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task with the given description and due date/time.

* @throws WrongFormatException If the date/time format is incorrect.
public Deadline(String description, String by) throws WrongFormatException {

* Converts the {@code Deadline} task into a formatted string suitable for file storage.
* @return A string representation of the {@code Deadline} task for file storage.
* Returns a string representation of the {@code Deadline} task,
* including its status, description, and formatted due date/time.
* @return A formatted string representation of the {@code Deadline} task.
* Represents an event task that occurs within a specific time range.
* An {@code Event} task includes a description, a start date/time, and an end date/time.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd-MM-yyyy HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, hh:mm a");
* Constructs an {@code Event} task with a description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start date and time in the format "dd-MM-yyyy HHmm".
* @param by The end date and time in the format "dd-MM-yyyy HHmm".
* @throws WrongFormatException If the date/time format is incorrect or the end time is before the start time.
public Event(String description, String from, String by) throws WrongFormatException {
throw new WrongFormatException("The end date/time of an event must be after the start date/time!");
throw new WrongFormatException("Invalid date/time format!\nCorrect format: DD-MM-YYYY HHMM");
* Converts the {@code Event} task into a formatted string suitable for file storage.
* @return A string representation of the {@code Event} task for file storage.
* Returns a string representation of the {@code Event} task,
* including its status, description, start time, and end time.
* @return A formatted string representation of the {@code Event} task.
* Represents an abstract task that can be marked as done or undone.
* This serves as a base class for specific task types such as ToDo, Deadline, and Event.
* Constructs a new {@code Task} with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns the status icon representing whether the task is done or not.
* "[X]" for completed tasks, "[ ]" for incomplete tasks.
* Returns the formatted string to be stored in a file.
* Subclasses must implement this method to define their own file format.
* @return The formatted string representing the task for storage.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* The format includes the status icon followed by the task description.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Represents a ToDo task in the task list.
* A ToDo task contains only a description without any date or time constraints.
* Constructs a ToDo task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Converts the ToDo task into a formatted string suitable for file storage.
* @return A string representation of the ToDo task for file storage.
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task, including its status and description.
* @return A formatted string representation of the ToDo task.

ToDo todo = new ToDo("Read a book");
assertEquals("[T] [X] Read a book", todo.toString(), "Marking ToDo as done failed!");
ToDo todo = new ToDo("Read a book");
assertEquals("[T] [ ] Read a book", todo.toString(), "Marking ToDo as undone failed!");
